meanings.definition: A person who thinks deeply or seriously.
meanings.sent1: She is known as a cogitator, always pondering life's mysteries.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher was a renowned cogitator in the academic community.
meanings.sent3: The cogitator sat by the window, lost in thought, oblivious to the passing time.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a busy cogitator, constantly analyzing and reflecting on the world around her.
meanings.sent5: As a cogitator, he delved into the complexities of human nature with unwavering curiosity.

meanings.definition: A machine or device that performs calculations or processes information.
meanings.sent1: The computer at the office is a powerful cogitator, handling complex tasks effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: In the future, cogitators will play a crucial role in advancing technology.
meanings.sent3: The little cogitator beeped happily after solving the math problem.
meanings.sent4: The cogitator hummed softly, processing data at an incredible speed.
meanings.sent5: The scientist marveled at the efficiency of the cogitator, amazed by its accuracy and speed.
